meanings.definition: The written text of a play, movie, or broadcast.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out scripts for the school play.
meanings.sent2: She studied the scripts to prepare for her role in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked across the scripts, leaving paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like a series of scripts, each scene carefully planned out.
meanings.sent5: The scripts contained the magic words that brought the characters to life on stage.

meanings.definition: Handwriting as distinct from print; written characters.
meanings.sent1: Her elegant scripts were admired by all her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The old letter was written in beautiful cursive scripts.
meanings.sent3: He tried to forge her scripts but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: Her scripts danced across the page, telling a story of their own.
meanings.sent5: The scripts on the ancient scroll were carefully preserved for centuries.

meanings.definition: A sequence of instructions that is interpreted and executed by a program.
meanings.sent1: The programmer wrote scripts to automate the tasks.
meanings.sent2: The computer followed the scripts to complete the task efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The robot misunderstood the scripts and started dancing instead of working.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a complex web of scripts, guiding his every move.
meanings.sent5: The scripts were the secret codes that unlocked the hidden features of the software.
